page.title: 10Helping Others in Fakenham
page.content: {The Talking Times}is a weekly recorded selection from local newspapers, run by 5 teams of volunteers. Cassettes are sent to over 110 registered blind and partially sighted people in the Fakenham and Dereham area. A managing committee organises fund raising for the purchase of equipment. {Meals on Wheels}are cooked and delivered to old people in the area by a large group of volunteers. {The Fakenham Round Table}was started in 1952. Its aims and objects are to help others through the fellowship of young men between the age of 18 and 40 They meet twice a month, in a special room behind the Bell Inn, Hempton. They hold monthly Bingo sessions at the old people's home, and raise money for local charities through social events. You have to leave at 40 yrs. old. There are 21 members at present.
